SENT.plain: Thyrotoxic periodic paralysis (TPP) is a rare manifestation of hyperthyroidism characterized by muscle weakness and hypokalemia
All ethnicities can be affected, but TPP typically presents in men of Asian descent
The most common cause of TPP in thyrotoxicosis is Graves' disease
However, TPP can occur with any form of thyrotoxicosis
Up to our knowledge, very few cases ever reported the relationship between TPP and painless thyroiditis
We herein report a 25-yr-old Korean man who suffered from flaccid paralysis of the lower extremities and numbness of hands
The patient was subsequently diagnosed as having TPP associated with transient thyrotoxicosis due to painless thyroiditis
The paralytic attack did not recur after improving the thyroid function
Therefore, it is necessary that early diagnosis of TPP due to transient thyrotoxicosis is made to administer definite treatment and prevent recurrent paralysis
